title: She’s running Boston to raise money for Homes For Our Troops
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Rebecca Ludwig, 34, from DeKalb County, GA, runs the 2026 Boston Marathon to raise money for Homes For Our Troops.
Homes For Our Troops provides mortgage-free, specially adapted homes for severely injured veterans to regain autonomy and stability.
Ludwig's marathon campaign supports designs like wheelchair-accessible layouts and provides pro-bono financial planning for three years.

title: Lawmakers urge Healey to  prepare for possible state prosecutions of federal officials
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Twenty-three Massachusetts state senators urged Gov. Maura Healey to prepare for possible state prosecutions of federal officials.
Their letter responds to federal abuse allegations, including shootings by ICE and other actions violating constitutional rights.
Proposals include creating a task force, issuing police guidance, and launching a portal for reporting federal misconduct.

title: She’s running Boston to honor her sister — and the hospital that treated her
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Hannah Orzechowski Murray from Malden is running the 2026 Boston Marathon on the Dana-Farber team.
She is running to honor her sister Grace, who passed away from glioblastoma after being treated at Dana-Farber.
The marathon also marks Grace's 30th birthday and the 5th anniversary of her passing.

title: Advocates, officials welcome judge’s move to block end of protections for Haitian immigrants
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A federal judge blocked the Trump administration's attempt to end Temporary Protected Status for 350,000 Haitian immigrants.
Judge Ana Reyes's ruling allows Haitians to remain in the U.S. as their lawsuit proceeds, relieving communities relying on their workforce.
Massachusetts officials emphasize Haitians' essential role in healthcare; Rep. Ayanna Pressley pushes for a long-term TPS extension.

title: What Robert Spillane and Harold Landry said about their injury statuses
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots edge rusher Harold Landry plans to play in the Super Bowl after missing the AFC Championship with a knee injury.
Linebacker Robert Spillane, recovering from foot and ankle injuries, intends to play in the Super Bowl for the Patriots.
Despite injury challenges, both Landry and Spillane participated in practice as the Patriots prepare for the Super Bowl.

title: Hundreds of apartments proposed for former Weylu’s site
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: A 300-unit apartment complex is proposed for the former Weylu's site on Route 1 in Saugus.
Saugus reached 11.22% affordable housing, becoming eligible for 'Safe Harbor' status, which could block the development.
Residents oppose the project due to potential increased traffic and impact on historic homes.

title: Ski Etiquette 101: What are your top do’s and don’ts for skiers and riders?
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Your Responsibility Code includes safety guidelines like staying in control and obeying signs on the slopes.
Vermont is the only state requiring lowering chairlift bars, sparking controversy among some skiers.
Common chairlift complaints include littering, smoking, swearing, and playing loud music.

title: PETA sues over Mass. wiretap laws, saying they impede animal cruelty investigations
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: PETA filed a federal lawsuit challenging Massachusetts' wiretap law requiring all-party consent for recording conversations.
The lawsuit names Massachusetts Attorney General Andrea Campbell and Hampden County DA Anthony Gulluni as defendants.
PETA seeks an exemption to conduct undercover animal cruelty investigations without violating state wiretap restrictions.

title: Ben Affleck teases Dunkin’ Super Bowl commercial with stars of ‘Seinfeld,’ ‘Friends’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Ben Affleck stars in a 2026 Dunkin' Super Bowl teaser with Jennifer Aniston, Jason Alexander, and Matt LeBlanc.
The commercial references '90s nostalgia with a VHS tape labeled 'Network Pilot '95 v3', labeled as 'cringe' by Affleck.
Produced by Affleck and Matt Damon's company, this is the fourth consecutive Dunkin' Super Bowl ad starring Affleck.

title: All the new movies and TV shows streaming in February
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Streaming services highlight romance films for Valentine's Day, with classics like 'You’ve Got Mail' on Netflix and 'When Harry Met Sally' on HBO Max.
Films by Black directors appear prominently on streaming for Black History Month, including 'Malcolm X' on HBO Max and 'Selma' on Peacock.
2025 films debut in 2026 streaming, including 'Splitsville' on Hulu (Feb. 6) and 'Eternity' on Apple TV (Feb. 13).
